  • Major Upcoming PC Games With 2026 Debuts Or No Release Year

PC players are nowadays seeing a lot of console-exclusive ports make their way to Steam and various launchers. This is great news for anyone who's felt like they've been missing out without owning a console, and it's clear that the lines between console and PC are beginning to blur, especially concerning Microsoft and its desire to port its impressive games library to both ecosystems. PC Game Pass has made things even more lucrative, and many series once thought console-locked forever are receiving PC versions (even if it takes a year or so to adapt them over).

Those playing games on a PC have a lot to look forward to in the remainder of 2025 and, also, beyond, with some high-profile ports, awesome-looking Indie releases, and AAA titles that are sure to look stunning on a high-end build. Here's a look at all the titles we can expect to see on the PC by the end of the year, along with games that do not have specific release dates.

What will be the best upcoming 2025 PC games ? Also, what could 2026 and beyond look like?

Updated October 4, 2025 by Mark Sammut: The following PC games were added to the scheduler: UNDISPUTED Championship Edition , Trenches VR , Double Dragon Dodgeball , Godbreakers , Kentum , Let It Die: Inferno , Firefighting Simulator: Ignite - Summer Camp , Juiced Fruit Racing , EMOTIONLESS : The Last Ticket , Steel Knight's ARMIS , Wanderer: The Fragments of Fate , The Séance of Blake Manor , Zero Caliber 2 Remastered , Whiskerwood.

Please note that the upcoming calendar focuses on North American release dates. Also, only major games have been included, as it would be impossible to list every upcoming PC game.

PC Games Coming Out In October 2025

Arc Raiders, Outer Worlds 2, Battlefield, Ninja Gaiden 4, Painkiller, & More

Assuming its games mostly live up to the hype, October should be 2025's best year for gaming. The lineup is stacked to the brim with big-ish releases, and the whole month is impressive. Directive 8020 will continue The Dark Pictures Anthology series with a trip into sci-fi horror territory, and it should be good.

Painkiller marks the return of a legendary cult classic FPS series, while Digimon Story: Time Stranger should be a great turn-based JRPG. Little Nightmares 3 has been a long time coming, and the same can be said for Ninja Gaiden 4 . Jurassic World Evolution 3 , The Outer Worlds 2 , and Arc Raiders are all huge releases as well. Finally, Battlefield 6 should and will be massive, as EA's sequel has been saying all the right things and making all the right moves.

Without a doubt, BO7 will be the best-selling PC game of the month, if not the entire year. It is just how things work nowadays.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Valhalla: The Best Weapons
item.description:
Ubisoft's Viking rendition of the historical-fiction epic Assassin's Creed has players take the role of a fierce Norseman, setting out to exact their brutal brand of vengeance. Assassin's Creed Valhalla is renowned for its atmospheric landscapes, fun combat, and cool Viking themes.

A major stand-out feature remains the slew of satisfying weapons, which can be enhanced and spruced up to dish out even more pain. With a grand and nuanced adventure like this, identifying the right weapons can be tricky, especially when factoring in the various upgrades, customizations, and playstyles Valhalla offers. Thus, it's a good idea to more closely examine some of the most powerful, versatile, and effective weaponry in the game.

Updated October 3, 2025, by Vlad Mazanko: Even after Assassin's Creed Shadows' release, Assassin's Creed Valhalla remains an equally engrossing open-world game with vast maps to explore and rewards to claim. Thanks to the sheer wealth of content in its massive base game and three sizable expansions, as well as loot and gear combat that feel drastically different from AC Shadows, players can spend hundreds of hours hunting for unique weapons and armor and upgrading them to the highest tiers of quality.

Valhalla's gear system doesn't rely on random drops; instead, it prompts players to treat every new find as a unique and valuable item worth keeping. Its flexible and engaging upgrade mechanics not only significantly boost weapon stats but also alter the appearance of nearly every weapon at higher quality tiers, adding extra motivation to enhance gear over the course of the adventure. This updated list highlights some of the best and most powerful weapons in Assassin's Creed Valhalla, along with its expansions, showcasing both their stats and striking designs.

Since each weapon's stats can vary with every new upgrade within the same quality tiers (Fine, Superior, Flawless, Mythical, Divine), the stats listed below reflect their current upgrade state as shown in the image.

item.title: Borderlands 4: Skull Orchid Boss Guide and Legendary Drops
item.description:
Skull Orchid is one of the many bosses that you can farm in Borderlands 4 , and its dedicated legendary drops have made it one of the most popular farming targets in the entire game. You can defeat Skull Orchid in seconds with the right build, which is why this boss is one of the best loot sources in all of Borderlands 4 .

Even if you don't get lucky with one of Skull Orchid's dedicated legendary drops, you'll still walk away from the battle with some sweet gear since it's an Auger Mine boss. It's also incredibly easy to reset this boss encounter with Moxxi's Big Encore, so you might spend more time battling Skull Orchid than you'd expect. Here's how to find and farm Skull Orchid in Borderlands 4 .

Borderlands 4 Skull Orchid Location

Skull Orchid is located at Embossed Fault , an Auger Mine in the Grindstone of the Worthy region of Carcadia Burn in Borderlands 4 . Just like all Auger Mines, you can't access Embossed Fault until you've cleared the Shadow of the Mountain main quest in Terminus Range. It's on the other side of the map, but you can complete it pretty early in the main story.

Once you've unlocked Auger Mines, just head to Carcadia Burn and make your way to the Embossed Fault Auger Mine in the southern part of Grindstone of the Worthy. The Auger Mine is infested with creeps , which can be super annoying, depending on your build. To make things worse, the creeps in the mine have different elemental affinities, so you'll need a balanced loadout if you want to take them out for XP and potential loot.

Skull Orchid is waiting for you at the end of the mine. It's a massive creep with a skull on its back, but it's surprisingly easy to defeat with just a single red health bar . You can melt it with a fire weapon or just focus your fire on the red tendrils extruding from the skull's mouth — that's its weak spot.

There are also smaller creeps in the arena that you can use to revive yourself if you go down.

Skull Orchid Legendary Drops

Skull Orchid has two dedicated legendary drops in Borderlands 4 .

Legendary

Description

Oak-Aged Cask Shield

Vintage: Only has one armor segment with huge capacity and slow recharge.

Roach Pistol

Flesh Eaters: Shoots eggs that hatch flying roaches when attached to flesh, living or dead.

Faulty Detonator Grenade

Sticky Trigger: Spawns combo orbs on detonation.

The three legendaries aren't particularly strong, but they have their uses for specific builds. Roach shoots eggs that hatch flying insects, but it's outclassed by most other legendary pistols in Borderlands 4 . The Oak-Aged Cask shield is a unique armor shield because it only has one massive segment that gets completely refilled when you collect an armor recharge pickup. It'll make you really tanky and borderline invincible if you have class abilities that generate armor segment recharge pickups. Then, there's the Faulty Detonator grenade, which is just like a normal grenade, only with way more explosions.

Since Skull Orchid is so easy to beat (and since the Moxxi's Big Encore machine is only a few steps away), it's one of the easiest bosses to farm in Borderlands 4 . It can still drop legendaries aside from its three dedicated rewards, so you can get lucky with any of Borderlands 4 's legendary weapons as long as they're not tied to other bosses.

item.title: Dark Souls 3 And Other Great Soulslikes That Deserve A Remaster
item.description:
The Soulslike genre is relatively new, which is why the idea of remastering titles in this genre may seem odd. However, if PlayStation has proven anything, it's that players will eat up remasters of recent critically-acclaimed titles even if they have their complaints about this approach.

Soulslikes that arrived when this genre was gaining steam can do with a modern reimagining, especially if the gameplay itself needs some fine-tuning. With more and more people getting into these hardcore titles, it's easy to see why remasters of both popular and flawed Soulslikes have a market.

Despite some flaws, Dark Souls 3 is still an excellent game that fans will love for its homage to the events of the first game, coupled with incredible boss fights that push players to reach new heights. A remaster can bring more eyes toward this title, especially with Elden Ring becoming such a massive success that more players want to check out FromSoftware's previous titles.

The gothic art style ropes players in before the game's Lovecraftian horror rears its nightmarish head and keeps players hooked till the very end. Now, players want to enjoy video games with a ton of effort behind them, and a great story will capture their attention in no time. However, some games go a bit too overboard in this department, to the point where these stories become harder to engage with.

David Cage's games may be fun cinematic experiences, but the stories themselves can be rather lacking. Nowhere is this more apparent than in Detroit: Become Human , where the rise of the AI revolution has allegories to real-life race riots during a dark period in American history.

If the game had told a riveting story, this could've been an enlightening way to show the trials and tribulations of the repressed, but Detroit: Become Human 's surface-level exploration of discrimination is downright insulting. The plot could've done without such heavy-handed allegories that exploit historical riots for entertainment, which leads to the story trying to appear way deeper than it actually is.
